quote: I risk eight strips, with a   purchase at six and a sale of ten.

quote: Quark, it's your move.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Just a moment --
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Aaghhh! I can't believe it!
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: You beg me to play tongo, and then   you don't pay attention to the   game.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I'll be right there.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Let me put it another way... if    you don't finish this hand, I'm    calling it a night.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Okay, okay!
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Who would have dreamed they'd    strike feldomite on Parsion Three?    The entire Sepian Commodities    Exchange is in chaos -- everyone    selling, prices falling --
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Evade!
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Are you sure?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: You heard me, evade!
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Okay.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Confront.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: You owe me fifteen strips of    latinum.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Take it, that's all I've got left.    (idly spins the wheel,    watches it go)   My antimonium options, my   quadrotriticale futures, my   powdered newt supplements -- all   wiped out. That's it, I'm   finished.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: It can't be as bad as all that.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: It can. And it is. I'm up to my    lobes in debt. I put the bar up    as collateral to three different    brokers. The loans are due in a    week and if I don't come up with    the latinum there'll be nothing    left of me but a greasy spot on    the Promenade.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Here?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Now?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Tell him I'm out.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: If that's the best lie you can    come up with, no wonder you're    broke.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Gaila! What a pleasant surprise.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I doubt it.        A clothed female. How    titillating.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Isn't this the cousin that tried    to kill you?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I see you've heard of me. Now if    you don't mind, I'd like to talk    to my dear cousin. Alone.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: If you're here for your latinum,    you've come a long way for nothing -   because that's all I can give you.    Nothing.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Spare me the sad story. I'm well    aware of your financial    "situation."       And I'm here to help.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: What are you going to do -- loan    me some exploding latinum?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I can understand your    skepticism... but I know a way to    help both of us. I'm offering you    a job.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: You'd defy the F.C.A. ban against    doing business with me?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: What's family for? Besides, I    won't tell them if you don't.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: You want me to sell weapons, don't    you?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: It's what I do. Now I know you've   had reservations about entering   this lucrative field.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: It's dangerous... it's too    technical... it's not a "people"    business... but let me tell you    something, cousin, nothing could    be further from the truth.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I told you before, I can't smuggle    weapons through this station. Odo    would be onto me in a second.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Who said anything about bringing    weapons here?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Then what do you need me for?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I need you to do the things you're    good at. Customer relations...    showing our clients a good time...    providing an atmosphere conducive    to closing deals.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I can do that.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Of course you can. And you'll    earn five percent of every sale.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Ten.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: You'll take five.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: I had no idea.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Weapons is a growth industry. In    a month, all your debts will be    paid. In six months, the Ferengi    Commerce Authority will be begging    to reinstate you. In a year,    you'll have your own moon.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: My own moon.
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Success or failure? What's it    going to be, cousin?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: What do I have to lose?
scene: 1    INT. QUARK'S - AFTER HOURS - CLOSE ON TONGO WHEEL

quote: Come in.
Morning, Chief!
Quiet! You'll wake him. He just    dropped off an hour ago.
You look terrible.
Didn't get much sleep. He was up    every hour or two. Every time I    tried to put him back in his crib    he started crying again. He    misses his mother.
When will Professor O'Brien be    back from Bajor?
I don't know, a week, maybe two -    however long it takes to get that    blight under control.
That long?
And on top of that, Annel had some    kind of family emergency. So I'm    stuck without a babysitter.
Don't worry, Chief. Everything's    going to be fine. I'll take care    of Yoshi.
(a bit skeptical, but     desperate)    You sure you're up to it?
Absolutely. I've babysat Ensign    Pran's hatchlings a couple of    times. Made sure their little    wings didn't get tangled.
Kirayoshi doesn't have wings.
Even better.
Looks like he's worn himself out.    He should sleep now. When he    wakes up, give him one of his    bottles. The diapers are in the    bag over there.
Don't worry, Chief, I know the    drill. Now go to work. You need    the rest.
I'll be fine. I went through the    same thing with Molly. It's just    a phase. He'll grow out of it    sooner or later.
Gently now...
You see, no problem.
I'll check in on you at lunch. If   you need me, I'm only a com-line   away.
He woke up.
Here, give him to me.
You're good.
He feels safe in my arms.
Hand me the bag. I'm taking him   with me.
To work?
What choice do I have?
What a great Daddy.
That's me.
Would you stop doing that.
Just being careful. Odo could be   anywhere or anything.
Quark, we saw him walk down the   Promenade five minutes ago.
He's very tricky.
There he is.
Where?
How good to see you again.
The pleasure is all mine.
Quark, this is my associate,    Hagath.
And my companion, Talura.
Your cousin speaks very highly of    you.
I've always said my cousin is an    excellent judge of character.
I admire confidence in a man. In    fact, I demand it of my salesmen.    But in business, one must be    careful not to grow too confident.
That can be a fatal mistake.
I believe the phrase you used to    bring me here was "an opportunity    of a lifetime."
An accurate description.
Show me.
Amuse yourself. I'll be back    shortly.
Very nice.
The weight and balance appear    right...
There's a wide range of targets    for you to choose from.
That won't be necessary.
A perfect replica. It even pulls    a little to the right, just like    the real ones.
These are the finest holosuites in    the sector.
I believe it.        Remember when we sold one hundred    fifty thousand of these to the    Manchovites?
And we sold another one hundred    thousand to the other side? Now    that was a beautiful little war.
Too bad about the armistice.
Well, all good things must come to    an end.
You sell weapons to opposing    sides?
On occasion. But it's very    dangerous. If either side    realizes what you're doing, it    could be very unpleasant.
But as they say... "The riskier    the road, the greater the profit."
True.    (surveying the     Holosuite)    I'm glad I came. This solves a    lot of our problems.

It certainly does. No actual    weapons coming in or out, so we    don't break any local laws. All    shipping happens outside    Federation space, so Starfleet    can't touch us. And since all    we're demonstrating are holograms,    we can even show off the specialty    items.
Well done, Gaila.
It was all Quark's idea.
You really are a find. I can tell    we're going to accomplish great    things together.
I can't wait.
Just one thing, Quark. Don't    cross me. Don't ever cross me.        Understood?
Completely.
Good. Now if it's not too much    trouble, I'd like to see my    quarters.
(looking at Hagath's    back)   If he were a bit shorter and his   teeth a little sharper... he'd   make a perfect Ferengi.
Why'd you tell him this was all my    idea?
I want him to like you.

The Breen CRM-one-fourteen works    equally well against moving    vessels or surface emplacements.    It's guaranteed to cut through    reactive armor in the six-to-   fifteen centimeter range, and    shields up to four-point-six    gigajoules.
It's light.
Nice.
The quick recharge is one of its    most popular features.
I'll take two thousand.
It's a pleasure doing business    with someone who appreciates a    fine weapon.
How'd I do?
You're a natural salesman.
I am, aren't I? It was no   different than selling sandwiches.
What did I tell you?
I always like to celebrate a job   well done.
To Quark.
Quark.
I'm going to like this job.
You wanted to see me?
(still focused on the     screen)    Just a moment.
Who would have thought there was    so much money to be made in    Andarian glass beads.        So how did things go with the    Proxcinians?
He purchased seven thousand    tritanium-plated assault skimmers.
Good. And he'll be back for more.    The Proxcinian War is just heating    up.
Lucky us.
I suppose you're wondering when    you'll start seeing your share of    the profits.
It had crossed my mind.
Well, I'm afraid it won't be soon.
I don't understand...
I've taken the liberty of    transferring your earnings    directly to your creditors.    You'll be happy to know they were    most appreciative.
I would've sent them their money.

I don't doubt your intentions.    But money does strange things to    people. And I can't afford to    have an associate distracted by    financial difficulties. So until    your debts are paid, I'm afraid    you won't be seeing any profit.
And once my debts are paid?

Your earnings will be yours to do    with as you like.        As long as you stay solvent.        You have to forgive me, Quark, but    my associates are like family to    me. And I feel it's my duty to    keep them out of trouble...
... as well as shower them with    affection. Go ahead, open it.
Andarian glass beads. These must    be worth...
An absolute fortune. Consider it    a token of my esteem.
Go ahead, beat that, Chief!
C'mon, Yoshi. It may not seem    fair forcing the good Doctor to    throw from farther away but he    does have the advantage of being    genetically engineered.
Miles, don't you think you should    put the baby down?
(only barely    overstating)   I haven't put Yoshi down for a   week. Besides, if I can carry him   while I'm at work, I can carry him   here.
There must be some babysitter on    the station that can pacify him...
Want to bet?
But you can't hold him forever.    You already have one bad    shoulder...
You want me to put the baby down?    Fine. I'll put the baby down.
Happy?
That's amazing.
No, this is amazing.
Now, if you'll excuse me... it's    my throw.
What do you say we go for the    double?    (as if getting a     response)    I agree.
That's right... keep going...    don't stop until you see smoke.
scene: 16   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON QUARK

quote: I hope I'm not interrupting    anything. I believe you know the    way to the Security Office.
scene: 16   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON QUARK

quote: None of these charges are going to    stick. I haven't broken any laws.    I have a license to run    holosuites...
But you don't have a license to    sell weapons, do you?
I defy you to prove that I've    brought a single weapon onto this    station.
A mere technicality. We both know    what you're doing. And I promise    you, you're going to face the    consequences.
Not today, he isn't.
Let him go.
Let him go?
Major, tell the constable what you    told me.

The Bajoran government insists    that Deep Space Nine not interfere    with the lawful transactions of    Hagath or his associates.    (off Odo's incredulous     look)    Hagath supplied arms to the    Resistance. Without him, and    others like him, we'd all be dead,    and the Cardassians would still be    in power. We owe him.
Captain...
I don't like it any more than you    do.
Better luck next time.
You better hope there isn't a next    time, mister. I've given you a    lot of slack in the past.

Even looked the other way once or    twice when I could've come down    hard on you. But those days are    over. We may not be able to get    you for selling weapons... but you    so much as litter on the Promenade    and I'm going to nail you to the    wall.
Something to look forward to.
You heard them. Now, get out of    my sight.
What's wrong with you people?    Don't you know how to lose with    dignity?
I'll never forget how many people    told us we were making a mistake.    "Sell weapons to the Bajorans?"
"What chance do they have?" they    said. "Invest in a winner, sell    to the Cardassians."
Why did you sell weapons to the    Bajorans? They couldn't have had    much money...
My dear Quark, not every deal is    about money. Sometimes, you have    to look at the big picture... and    at times gaining a friend can be    more important than earning    profit.
I admit it's not the Ferengi way,    but it's good business    nonetheless.
I knew eventually the Cardassians    were going to lose. And why?
Because they were overly    confident?
Exactly. They underestimated the    Bajoran thirst for freedom. I    didn't.
You want me to handle this?
No.        Come in.
Farrakk, so glad you could join    us.
What was so important that you had    to see me in person? I was about    to close that deal with the    Verillians.
Really? I heard they're no longer    in need of our services.
Since when?
Since they signed an agreement    with the Metron Consortium. I    also heard that you never even    opened negotiations with the    Verillians...
That's a lie.
And that instead of doing your    job, you were off enjoying    yourself on Risa.
I can explain. I was --
I'm not interested in    explanations. I put my faith in    you and you've let me down. As of    this moment, our relationship is    terminated.
You can keep the monies I advanced    you. Consider it your severance    pay.
Hagath, can't we talk this over?   I made a mistake --
A very costly mistake. Good-bye.
That was unpleasant.       Now, what were we talking about?
Evening, cousin.
Business always this good?
I haven't had a single Starfleet    customer all day... come to think    of it, nobody from the Federation    has come through those doors. I    must be "off limits."
Quark, as long as we keep that    holosuite busy, you've got nothing    to worry about. Which reminds me.    We have a very special client    arriving next week. The Regent of    Palamar.
Never heard of him.
He's very, very wealthy.
Can't wait to meet him.
He's also very particular about    how he's treated.
As well he should be. After all,    he's a Regent.
I have to say, Cousin, you've done    well. And it couldn't have come    at a better time. For both of us.
Why's that?
I'm thinking about stepping back.    Taking it easy for a change. You    could take my place, run things    with Hagath. You'd earn a bigger    share of the profit.
Have you spoken to Hagath about   this?
He likes you, Quark.
And I like him. I'd also like a   bigger share of the profits.
Then everyone's happy.       Except for Farrakk.
What about Farrakk?
Didn't you hear? His ship blew up    shortly after he left the station.    Warp core breach.         That Hagath, what a temper.
Are you saying... Hagath killed    him?
You heard what he said, cousin.    He doesn't like to be crossed.    Just make sure you don't forget    that.
Double snail juice. Extra smooth.
Good morning, commander.
Mind if I join you?
Actually, I do.
That's okay, I won't take it    personally.
Quark, I'm busy.
I have to admit, I'm a little    disappointed in you. I thought    you, of all people, would    understand.
Understand what? That you've    finally shown how despicable you    truly are? You don't care how    many people die as long as you    make a profit.
Who said anything about people    dying? The weapons I sell are    strictly defensive. To be well    armed is a deterrent to war -    don't you know anything about the    balance of power?
Quark... you don't really believe    any of that, do you?

Jadzia... there was nothing else    I could do. I was drowning... the    waters were closing over my    head... and just as my lungs were    about to burst, my cousin threw me    a lifeline. How could I possibly    refuse?
Feeling a little guilty, Quark?
Guilty? Me? I don't have    anything to feel guilty about.
Then why come to me asking for    forgiveness?
I've got good news. Your son's    fine.
Except that he cries constantly    unless I'm holding him.
I've given him every imaginable    test. Eyes, ears, digestive,    pulmonary and nervous systems -    there's nothing medically wrong    with him.
What are you telling me, that my    baby is just... sad?
Perhaps he's become prematurely    aware of life's existential    isolation.
You're sure it's not a rash?
Look at the positive side: he'll    probably be a great poet.         There's nothing else I can do for    you.
Yes, there is.
What's wrong?
My neck.
Don't move. I'll get a neural    modulator.

Palamarian sea urchin, lightly    sauteed in garlic and moon grass...    Matopin rock fungi tossed on a bed    of tartoc and seasoned with    Clavisoa berries... and for the    main course, stuffed Wentlian    condor snake.
All of the Regent's favorite    dishes. I obtained the recipes    through his palace chefs, in    exchange for a small gratuity.
Quark, do you mind if I ask a    question?
Go ahead.
Are you trying to ruin me on    purpose, or is this sheer    incompetence?
Ruin you? I don't want to --
Here we are, about to open    negotiations with an important new    client... and this is the welcome    you've prepared for him?
But they told me he'll like it.
This? He's going to like this?
Yes...
Well, he should. It's delicious.
I really had him going, didn't I?
(having enjoyed the     show)   Oh, you had him, you definitely   had him!
Quark, I love you.       It's magnificent, all of it!
So glad you approve.
All right, enough fun. The Regent   will be here soon. We are going   to make some money tonight.

... Nassuc was the best officer I    ever had. I took her out of the    ranks and made her a general. In    time, she would have inherited my    entire empire. And how does she    repay me?        She declares independence for her    homeworld.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Betrayal. It's the one    unforgivable sin. Especially when    it's committed by someone you    trusted implicitly.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Most arms dealers wouldn't    understand such matters. They    have no ideals, no passions,    except for lining their own    pockets. But, I feel that you are    a man of honor.        That you are all men of honor.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: How very perceptive of you,    Regent.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Now, how can we help you?
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: I want to make an example of    Nassuc and her followers. First,    I intend to eradicate her capital    city.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: What kind of casualties are you    looking for?
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Seven... maybe eight million.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: We can help you with that.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: But that's just the beginning.   Over the next couple of months, I   would like the death toll to   rise... slowly but steadily.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Give us a figure.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Let's say... twenty million.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: What would be most effective?   Prions?
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Either that or a mutagenic   retrovirus. What do you think,   Quark?
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Twenty-eight million dead? Can't   we just wound some of them?
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: I'm here to buy weapons. Are you    here to sell them?
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Absolutely. Quark was just trying    to make a little joke, but    unfortunately...        ... Ferengi humor doesn't translate    too well.
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: So let's forgo any further    attempts at jocularity and get    down to business. Shall we?
scene: 27   INT. HAGATH'S QUARTERS - LATER - THE SAME DISH

quote: Quark, maybe I haven't made myself    clear... I've been in the weapons    business for forty years. I want    to retire.
I don't blame you.
But I'm not going to be able to    retire if my hand-picked successor    can't control his conscience.
The Regent is insane...
Stop being so judgmental. It's    his bank account, not his mental    health that you should be    concerned with.
But twenty-eight million people...    it just seems wrong.

(looking around, making     sure they're alone)    If Hagath heard you talk that    way... he'd toss you out the    nearest airlock.    (points out the     viewport)    Look out there. Millions and    millions of stars -- millions upon    millions of worlds. And right    now, half of them are fanatically    dedicated to destroying the other    half. Do you think if one of    those twinkling little lights    suddenly went out, anybody would    notice? Suppose I offered you ten    million bars of gold-pressed    latinum to help turn out one of    those lights... would you really    tell me to keep my money?
The Vulcan science vessel T'Pan is    requesting permission to dock.
Put her at Docking Bay Three.
The Wellington has finished    refueling. It should decouple    within the hour.
Got it.
Sir, what can I do for you?
Why is everyone whispering?
Ssshhh!
Why the hell are we whispering?
It's the baby, sir.
Baby?
Kirayoshi.  He's asleep, Captain.
Where?
In the pit, sir.
In the pit?
Yes, sir.
Chief, why is the baby in the pit?
It's kind of hard to explain, sir.
Try.
Chief, why don't you take a few    days off until Keiko gets back?    I think we can manage without you    that long.
That won't be necessary, sir. I    have the situation well in hand.
What I'm trying to tell you,    Chief, is that keeping Kirayoshi    in the pit is not an acceptable    solution. Find another one.
Yes, sir.
Sir?
Yes, Chief?
Can we wait 'til he wakes up to    move him? He just dropped off.
Very well. But then I want him   out of there.       Don't you people have work to do?
Captain --
Hello, Quark.
You don't look so good.
That's because I'm dead.
Dax.
Relax, Quark.
Jake --
Way to go, Quark. I had my whole   life ahead of me.
I didn't do anything.
You killed us all.
Hold on, now. You can't blame me.
Deny it all you want... but you're   responsible.
I hope it was worth it...
How much latinum did they pay you,   Quark?
Enough to buy a new conscience?
(trying to convince     himself)   This isn't my fault!
Why, Quark? Why did you kill my   baby?
No... no... noooo...
What have I done?
What the hell are you doing in    here?
I wanted you to have this.
You broke into my quarters to give    me a tongo wheel? Get out of here    before I call Security.
I'm going.
And take that thing with you.
I can't. It's a gift.
You think you can buy back my    friendship?
It's not a bribe... Chances are I    won't be needing it anymore.        Good-bye, Dax.
Don't let the door hit you on the    way out.
Don't you want to know where I'm    going?
Not really.
What if I said it was dangerous?
Figures.        It doesn't matter. Where I'm    going... you can't follow. What    I have to do... I have to do    alone. One man... who's had    enough... who's going to stand up    and say --
Good-bye, Quark.
Nervous? The worst Hagath can do    is kill you.        What's one life compared to the    lives of twenty-eight million    people?
What do you mean you can't get    your hands on the mutagenic    retrovirus?
Our supplier sold all he had to    Minnobia for their war against the    Vek.
This isn't good. I just finished    telling the Regent that his    shipment will be delivered within    a week. He's about to leave.        He is not going to be happy.
I know -- he'll be stuck with    twenty-eight million people and no    way to kill them.    (then offering some    hope)   Lucky for us, I can get hold of   some Varaxian LM-Seven.
Never heard of it.
It's a new biogenic weapon...    still in the experimental stage.
How effective is it?
They'll be dropping like flies.    Only trouble is I don't know how    much of it I can get.        You think the Regent would be    satisfied with only seventeen    million people killed?
Seventeen million... it's better    than nothing.

Then what you have to do is tell    him there's been a change of    plans.    (as if thinking on his    feet)   Tell him we have something new to   show him... might take a little   longer to get the results he   wants, but we'll give him a twenty   percent discount. In the   meantime, I'll have a sample of   Varaxian LM-Seven sent here and   we'll arrange for a small   demonstration. We'll find a   planet with some low-level   lifeforms no one will miss.
I'll talk to the Regent, keep him    from leaving. You make sure you    get that sample here as soon as    possible.        Don't fail me, Quark.
Believe me, I want this deal to go    through more than anybody. I'm    finally out of debt -- these will    be the first profits I get to    keep.
(slapping him on     shoulder)    Be quick.
Stop looking so unhappy. The dabo    tables will still be there when    you get back.
scene: 44   INT. HABITAT RING CORRIDOR - ANOTHER SECTION

quote: But I was winning. What could be    more important than that?
scene: 44   INT. HABITAT RING CORRIDOR - ANOTHER SECTION

quote: I told you, there's someone I want    you to meet.
scene: 44   INT. HABITAT RING CORRIDOR - ANOTHER SECTION

quote: Gaila, meet General Nassuc, head    of the Palamarian Freedom Brigade.
Pleased to meet you.    (immediately grabbing     Quark's arm)    We need to talk.
Will you excuse us for a moment?
What is that female doing on the    station?
I invited her.
Are you crazy? She's the Regent's    mortal enemy! Does he know she's    here? Does Hagath?
Of course not.
You're scaring me, Cousin.
Relax. I know selling weapons to    opposing sides is dangerous... but    as you said yourself, "The riskier    the road -- "
Don't quote The Rules of    Acquisition to me! If Hagath    finds out we're doing this behind    his back, we'll wind up as dead as    Farrakk.
Only if we fail. And we're not    going to fail -- we're going to    sell Varaxian LM-Seven to both the    Regent and the General.
Is she interested?
She jumped at the chance. She's    as crazy as the Regent. Both    sides will poison each other,    we'll double our profits, and    Hagath will be very happy.
But what if they see one another -   realize what we're doing?
It's a busy station. We'll keep    them far apart. Just think of all    that latinum.
What do you want me to do?
Keep the General occupied for    twenty minutes, then take her to    Cargo Bay Five. I'll meet you    there.
Open it.
You heard him.
That's odd.
What's wrong?
Nothing.       Right, Quark?
The code sequencer isn't working.
Then fix it.
Right away
I just need to get a descrambler.    And while I'm at it, I'll get a    bottle of champagne -- to    celebrate.
Forget the champagne. Just get    back here as quickly as you can.
Whatever you say.
He'll be right back.
Quark, where are you going?
scene: 48   INT. CORRIDOR - OUTSIDE CARGO BAY FIVE

quote: I'll be right back.       I just need to get a descrambler.
scene: 48   INT. CORRIDOR - OUTSIDE CARGO BAY FIVE

quote: After you.
scene: 48   INT. CORRIDOR - OUTSIDE CARGO BAY FIVE

quote: There are reports of phaser fire    in Cargo Bay Five. Seal the area.    This is a priority-one alert.
Good afternoon, Commander.
Chief, my schedule shows you were    supposed to begin modifying the    deflector array aboard the Defiant    today.
I'm sorry, sir. The Captain    thought I could use a few days    leave and I decided to take him up    on it.
To care for your son.
Taking care of a baby can be a    full-time job.
Look, do me a favor and hold him    for a minute. I need to get his    bottle. He'll cry, but it's okay -   there's nothing wrong with him.
Chief, I must attend to --
It'll only take a minute.
What's the matter?
The baby... he's not crying.
He's not crying.
(looking at the baby, a     beat)    I never saw my son when he was    this age.        It is something I will always    regret. You are a fortunate man.    Chief... Chief?
You're facing some serious    charges, Quark. Incitement to    riot, endangering the public    safety, disregard for --
How was I supposed to know    everyone was going to start    shooting? I just wanted them to    cross paths so the deal would fall    through.
It fell through, all right.    Hagath and Gaila barely managed to    get off the station alive.
I hear General Nassuc sent a    purification squad after them...
I wouldn't count on seeing your    former business partners again.
I can live with that.
What about the Regent's death?
The Regent's dead?
A purification squad caught up    with him early this morning.
I can live with that, too. And I    can think of twenty-eight million    other people who won't mind either.
So, about those charges -- surely    we can come to some sort of...    accommodation.
That depends.
On what?
This is what it's going to cost to    repair the cargo bay.
That much?
That much.
Well... maybe we could come up    with some sort of installment    plan.
Works for me.
Retreat.
Acquire.
Confront.
Evade.
The risk is at ten, with a    purchase of seven and a sale of    fourteen.
Nice move. But then again you    have a knack for getting out of    tight spots.
It's a gift.       About my tongo wheel...
It's no longer your tongo wheel.    You gave it to me, remember?
I know I gave it to you, but at    the time I thought --
I'm not giving it back, Quark.    And that's final.
Confront.
Retreat.
